t: Psalm 71
In*pn you, Lord,*s I have taken refuge; let*ld me never be put to shame.
In*ln your righteousness, rescue me and deliver me; turn*ld your ear to me and save me.
Be*ln my rock of refuge, to*ld which I can always go; give*ln the command to save me, for*ld you are my rock and my fortress.
Deliver*ln me, my God, from the hand of the wicked, from*ld the grasp of those who are evil and cruel.
For*pn you have been my hope, Sovereign Lord,*s my*ld confidence since my youth.
From*ln birth I have relied on you; you*ld brought me forth from my mother’s womb. I*ld will ever praise you.
I*ln have become a sign to many; you*ld are my strong refuge.
My*ln mouth is filled with your praise, declaring*ld your splendor all day long.
Do*pn not cast me away when I am old; do*ld not forsake me when my strength is gone.
For*ln my enemies speak against me; those*ld who wait to kill me conspire together.
They*ln say, “God has forsaken him; pursue*ld him and seize him, for*ld no one will rescue him.”
Do*ln not be far from me, my God; come*ld quickly, God, to help me.
May*ln my accusers perish in shame; may*ld those who want to harm me be*ld covered with scorn and disgrace.
As*pn for me, I will always have hope; I*ld will praise you more and more.
My*pn mouth will tell of your righteous deeds, of*ld your saving acts all day long— though*ld I know not how to relate them all.
I*ln will come and proclaim your mighty acts, Sovereign Lord;*s I*ld will proclaim your righteous deeds, yours alone.
Since*ln my youth, God, you have taught me, and*ld to this day I declare your marvelous deeds.
Even*ln when I am old and gray, do*ld not forsake me, my God, till*ln I declare your power to the next generation, your*ld mighty acts to all who are to come.
Your*pn righteousness, God, reaches to the heavens, you*ld who have done great things. Who*ld is like you, God?
Though*ln you have made me see troubles, many*ld and bitter, you*ld will restore my life again; from*ln the depths of the earth you*ld will again bring me up.
You*ln will increase my honor and*ld comfort me once more.
I*pn will praise you with the harp for*ld your faithfulness, my God; I*ln will sing praise to you with the lyre, Holy*ld One of Israel.
My*ln lips will shout for joy when*ld I sing praise to you— I*ld whom you have delivered.
My*ln tongue will tell of your righteous acts all*ld day long, for*ln those who wanted to harm me have*ld been put to shame and confusion.
